intro: Gynampsis flexuosa, commonly known as the flexible gynampsis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, twisting stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a tubular corolla. Gynampsis flexuosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest undergrowth.
